question: 購読
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>subscription</kanji> has been <kanji>read</kanji>. Each magazine that comes in you read. This is your <vocabulary>subscription</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The on'yomi for <ja>読</ja> (<ja>どく</ja>) is the same as the reading in <ja>読者</ja>. In case you forgot, think about how you just got a subscription to <reading>dock</reading> (<ja>どく</ja>) magazine. It's all about docks and dock related things. How exciting.
